means: （使）改变方向，改变目的( swerve的现在分词 )

sentence.Network_en: Hyde accelerated away from the kerb, swerving out into the middle of the street.
sentence.Network_cn: 海德加速驶离路边，突然向街道中央一个急转弯。

sentence.Network_en: It may stand as an example of the fitful swerving of his passion.
sentence.Network_cn: 这是一个例子,说明他的情绪往往变化不定,忽冷忽热.

sentence.Network_en: Mrs Merkel would be foolish to placate her base by swerving right.
sentence.Network_cn: 默克尔夫人如果为了安抚她的根基所在而转到右翼就太愚蠢了.

PerfectNetExp.abs: swerve 闪避, swerving 变换方向, swerving 偏移

河南大学体育学院·足球——河南大学国家级精品课程 ... 96 颠球 juggling 97 弧线球 curve ball;swerving ball 98 内弧球 inswinger.

entry.def: If a vehicle or other moving thing swerves or if you swerve it, it suddenly changes direction, often in order to avoid hitting something.

example.ex: Drivers coming in the opposite direction swerved to avoid the bodies...
example.tran: 从对面来的汽车司机急忙转向以免撞到那些尸体。

example.ex: Her car swerved off the road into a 6ft high brick wall...
example.tran: 她的车突然转向冲出了马路，撞向 6 英尺高的一面砖墙。

means.word_mean: 1. the act of turning aside suddenly
